contentrichtext.text: '''Timothy Chambers''' is a [[philosopher]] who has written a number of articles which have appeared in the journals ''Mind'' ([http://mind.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/reprint/109/434/195 2000], [http://mind.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/reprint/110/439/709 2001]), the ''Monist'' (1998), ''Philosophy'' (2001), the ''[http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/bpl/paso/2000/00000100/00000001/art00067 Aristotelian Society Proceedings]''(2000), and ''Ratio'' (1999). His research interests include [[Hilary Putnam]], [[time travel]], the [[Ontological Argument]], the [[Doomsday Argument]] and the [[semantics]] of [[vagueness]]. His work on Putnam included a logical formula—the Chambers Conditional<ref>{{cite web |url = http://mind.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/110/437/45 |title = On being in a quandary. Relativism vagueness logical revisionism - Wright 110 (437): 45 - Mind |accessdate = 2008-06-07|archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5vBMA2c9F |archivedate = 2010-12-22|deadurl=no}}</ref>—which figures in [[Crispin Wright]]'s recent work on vagueness. <ref>[http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/faculty/members/docs/inaugural.pdf] {{Wayback|url=http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/faculty/members/docs/inaugural.pdf|date =20061006170748}}</ref><ref>[http://www.st-andrews.ac.uk/philosophy/arche/pages/papers/Wright%20Liars%20and%20Heaps.pdf]{{dead link|date=June 2008}}</ref> == References == {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Chambers, Timothy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chambers, Timothy}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century philosophers]] {{Philosopher-stub}}
